{{velocity}} ## You can modify this page to customize the presentation of your object. ## At first you should keep the default presentation and just save the document. ## We have to use wiki=true because $doc.display() can produce wiki syntax. {{html wiki="true" clean="false"}} ## Load the JavaScript code required to make the object properties editable in-place. #set ($discard = $xwiki.jsfx.use('uicomponents/edit/editableProperty.js', { 'forceSkinAction': true, 'language': $xcontext.locale })) #set ($editing = $xcontext.action == 'edit') ## The object to display. #set ($xobject = $doc.getObject('XWiki.MyClass')) ## The class that describes the object properties. #set ($xclass = $xobject.xWikiClass) ## Make sure the following display* method calls use the right object. #set ($discard = $doc.use($xobject)) ## Using the xform vertical form layout.
#foreach ($property in $xclass.properties)
## This must match the id generated by the $doc.display() method below. #set ($propertyId = "${xclass.name}_${xobject.number}_$property.name") $escapetool.xml($property.translatedPrettyName) ## Support for specifying a translation key as hint in the property definition. $!escapetool.xml($services.localization.render($property.hint))
$doc.display($property.name)
#end #if (!$xclass.properties || $xclass.properties.size() == 0) ## Keep the empty definition term in order to have valid HTML.
$escapetool.xml($services.localization.render('xclass.defaultObjectSheet.noProperties'))
#end
{{/html}} {{/velocity}}
